DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To develop evidence-based strategy assess risk significant hyperbilirubinemia healthy term near-term ( late-preterm ) neonate . Hypothesis : A stepwise strategy combine clinical parameter serial non-invasive transcutaneous bilirubin ( TcB ) value could reliably predict significant neonatal hyperbilirubinemia . Methods : Data neonate > 34 week ' gestation include registry neonatal hyperbilirubinemia well-baby nursery University Hospital Patras , January 2008 December 2010 review . The registry include prospectively collect data sex , gestational age , gestation perinatal information , mother 's infant 's ABO group Rh , G6PD deficiency , Coombs test , type delivery complication , birthweight , postnatal medication intervention , type volume feed ( daily ) , extension jaundice , TcB measurements interval 12+/-4 hour discharge , total serum bilirubin value ( obtain ) , TcB TSB measurement follow-up , weight discharge , need phototherapy ( inpatient discharge ) . TcB TSB value plot hour-specific chart . A novel predictive nomogram base TcB measurement ( Varvarigou et al . Pediatrics 2009 ; 124:1052-9 ) use classify TcB value high , intermediate , low risk . Significant hyperbilirubinemia define TSB value phototherapy threshold level accord AAP 2004 guideline Statistics : Independent joint effect various clinical factor development significant hyperbilirubinemia evaluate logistic regression analysis Cluster analysis Chi-squared Automatic Interaction Detection ( CHAID ) tree method use develop strategy . At step , CHAID choose independent ( predictor ) variable strong interaction dependent variable . Categories predictor merge significantly different respect dependent variable .
